interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Flight of the Navigator
Review Date: 2021/01/08
Store: Joey Cramer  (Actor),     Veronica Cartwright  (Actor),     Randal Kleiser  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. After a mystifying disappearance, David returns, possessing vast, undiscovered knowledge about the farthest reaches of the universe. With these sudden navigational powers, David is able to take the fantastic flying machine anywhere he desires, accompanied by both its wisecracking robotic commander, Max, and an assortment of bizarre extraterrestrial creatures! Embark on a fun-filled, fast-paced journey of fantasy and adventure as David takes off on the flight of a lifetime! Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. (Ages 6 and older)", '--Lynn Gibson']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Action/Adventure, LIVE', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howard Hesseman, Albie Whitaker, Iris Acker, Randal Kleiser, Joey CramerRichard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howar…  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.5 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2259724', 'Director': 'Randal Kleiser', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 1, 2004', 'Actors': 'Joey Cramer, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff De Young, Sarah Jessica Parker, Matt Adler', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Michael Burton, Matt MacManus', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This is one of those movies I watch at least once a year.  An all-time favorite.  David gets sent to the future...He's obviously the same, but his family has aged.  Travels across the globe with the assistance of a sentient spacecraft voiced by Peewee.  What's not to like?
Review Title: Top 10 Movies
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Fifth Element (Remastered) [Blu-ray] Bruce Willis (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure ['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley'] {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'} Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had. Seriously a well done remaster. Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeremiah Chechik'], 'Producers': ['William S. Picked this up on sale Alita: Battle Angel Blu-ray Rosa Salazar (Actor), Christoph Waltz (Actor), Roberto Rodriguez (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray ['A deactivated cyborg is revived, but cannot remember anything of her past life and goes on a quest to find out who she is.'] {'Genre': 'Action/Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Casper Van Dien, Lana Condor, Eiza Gonzalez, Mahershala Ali, Keean Johnson, Rick Yune, Racer Maximiliano Rodriguez-AvellÃ¡n, Idara Victor, Jennifer Connelly, Jorge Lendeborg, Derek Mears, Hugo Perez, Jeff Fahey, Leonard Wu, Marko Zaror, Christoph Waltz, Jackie Earle Haley, Roberto Rodriguez, Laeta Kalogridis, Ed Skrein, James Cameron, Rosa SalazarCasper Van Dien, Lana Condor, Eiza Gonzalez, Mahershala Ali, Keean Johnson, Rick Yune, Racer Maximiliano Rodriguez-AvellÃ¡n, Idara Victor, Jennifer Connelly, Jorge Lendeborg, Derek Mears, Hugo Perez, Jeff Fahey, Leonard Wu, Marko Zaror, Christoph Waltz, Jackie Ear… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.2 x 6.7 inches; 1.41 Ounces', 'Director': 'Roberto Rodriguez', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Release date': 'July 23, 2019', 'Actors': 'Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz, Mahershala Ali, Ed Skrein, Keean Johnson', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX', 'Writers': 'James Cameron, Laeta Kalogridis', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Great movie! Definitely going to be a cult classic in about a decade. Excellent Movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Danny DeVito'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lazar', 'Peter Macgregor-Scott'], 'Starring': ['Robin Williams', 'Edward Norton', 'Catherine Keener'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Wife decided we had to watch this movie ASAP, so we bought the streaming version. Wish there was a BluRay version at a reasonable price, but I guess we'll be able to watch this again as long as it's available online.

Great movie. It's a classic - Norton is fantastic, and Williams is an absolute gem. Wish there was a BluRay {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Ray Bouderau', 'Courtney Chenn', 'Scott H. Cohen', 'Patrick W. Dugan', 'Scott Fischer', 'Elliot Grainge', 'Grant Guthrie', 'Brent Guttman', 'David Haring'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Alex Winter', 'Kristen Schaal'], 'Studio': ['United Artist Releasing']} This film is by far the best sequel a movie could ever have. Stays true to the roots of the originals with only a bit of retcon going on. Without giving anything away, the best character has to be Dennis. Wow...The whole family has been quoting this movie for a couple of weeks now. It's a must-watch if you're a fan of the originals. Such a good job. Most excellent {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Engler'], 'Producers': ['Gareth Neame', 'Julian Fellowes', 'Liz Trubridge', 'Nigel Marchant', 'Brian Percival'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Bonneville', 'Jim Carter', 'Michelle Dockery'], 'Studio': ['Focus Features']} My wife started watching the series a few weeks back and once it was finished she just had to watch the movie. I mean..I kinda liked it. I was never a fan of soap operas, but this one isn't half bad. Fine, I liked it. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user maintains a robust enthusiasm for action and sci-fi movies, along with a deep appreciation for high-quality TV series featuring rich narratives. Nostalgic comedies from their childhood continue to resonate, reflecting their fond memories.

- **Media Format Preference:** With a preference for Blu-ray and high-quality remasterings, the user is open to streaming options when necessary, reinforcing their commitment to an optimal viewing experience.

- **Rating Trends:** The user enjoys a high average rating of 4.8, indicative of their discerning taste for outstanding storytelling and production quality. Their recent interaction, which showcased an all-time favorite watched annually, reveals a strong affinity for nostalgic content.

- **Favorite Themes:** Unique storytelling with elements of adventure and fantasy, paired with nostalgia and humor, are significant thematic draws.

- **Director and Actor Appreciation:** While originally favoring directors like Luc Besson and actors such as Bruce Willis, their admiration is now expanding to include talents like Joey Cramer and Sarah Jessica Parker, reflecting a growing interest in diverse storytelling.

- **Review Behavior:** The user shares detailed, enthusiastic reviews focusing on emotional connections, nostalgia, and personal enjoyment. Their recent review highlights an unwavering love for particularly nostalgic favorites, emphasizing the film's engaging elements and emotional resonance, contributing to their ongoing exploration of innovative content.
